title: Day 01 (Resonance and Filters)
description: Understand the concept of resonance in RLC circuits and explore how filters like low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, and band-stop work to shape electrical signals. Includes practical examples and theory breakdown.
subject: theory-of-electricity
author: Teshan Kannangara

title: Day 02 (Fundamental and Network Theorems)
description: Dive into essential network theorems such as Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Laws, Thevenin’s and Norton’s Theorems. Learn how to simplify and analyze complex electrical circuits using these powerful tools.
subject: theory-of-electricity
author: Kalana Lakshan

title: Programming with Functions
description: Learn the basics of program construction using functions and modular design.
subject: methods-of-mathematics
author: Dr. Emily Stone

title: Electric Circuits 101
description: Explore voltage, current, resistance, and basic circuit laws in electrical theory.
subject: theory-of-electricity
author: Prof. David Miller

title: Effective Communication Techniques
description: Master verbal and non-verbal communication for academic and professional settings.
subject: communication-skills
author: Ms. Jennifer Parker

title: Data Structures Overview
description: Learn about arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues with visual explanations.
subject: data-structures-and-algorithms
author: Dr. John Blake

title: Algorithms and Sorting
description: Understand sorting algorithms like bubble sort, insertion sort, and merge sort.
subject: data-structures-and-algorithms
author: Dr. John Blake
